Placemark.name: Canadian Roots Exchange - Kamloops YRI Team
Placemark.description: The Kamloops YRI Team from Canadian Roots Exchange hosted a Blanket Exercise with the Hills of Peace Lutheran Church & Lil Michif Otipemiwisiwak Family & Community Services. Youth were provided with supper and learned about the colonial history of Canada

Placemark.name: Canadian Roots Exchange - Kamloops YRI Team
Placemark.description: Youth from Kamloops, BC attended CRE's 7th National Youth Gathering  fromNov. 15-17, 2018 at the University of Saskatchewan. 2 of the Kamloops YRI facilitated a workshop and the other 3 were participants during the gathering.

Stage two partner for Canadian Conservation Corps  

This partner is focusing on creating the Castle Provincial Park  including an indigenous garden.

Placemark.name: CE1816
Placemark.description: Mettre en place un piano public

Placemark.name: CE1825
Placemark.description: Le projet consiste alors à offrir des cours d’art gratuits pour les enfants dans des centres communautaires ou des organisations qui ont pour but d’aider des familles, parents, ou enfants qui normalement ne pourraient pas bénéficier de ces cours. Le projet débute avec moi, mais avec du temps, il y a beaucoup de centres où il pourrait être implémenté et plusieurs nouveaux étudiants en art pourraient offrir des cours afin d’aider plus de jeunes et enrichir leurs CV dans le domaine où ils veulent travailler plus tard.

Placemark.name: Chantiers d'entrepreneuriat
Placemark.description: Le  projet s'appelle Life Academy. C'est une plateforme d'éducation où les jeunes peuvent donner et reçevoir des cours pratiques (gestion des finances, taxes, gestion du temps, etc.) Il existe un besoin pressant chez les jeunes de ma communauté d'apprendre ces compétences qui ne sont pas offertes dans le système d'éducation. De plus, entreprendre des cours et des projets permettraient aux jeunes d'éxplorer une passion (nécessaire au CEGEP), de développer leur CV et de construire un réseau professionel dans leur champs d'intérêt.

Placemark.name: Chantiers d'entrepreneuriat -1806
Placemark.description: Salon de soins corporels pour les femmes vivant en situation d'itinérance

Placemark.name: Chantiers d'entrepreneuriat -1806
Placemark.description: Salon de soins corporels pour les femmes vivant en situation d'itinérance

Placemark.name: CJ social entrepreneurship project
Placemark.description: On April 15th, a team of 4 volunteers from a collegial social work class brought together twenty homeless women to offer them a day of care. They spared no effort to pamper the women targeted by the project. In addition to makeup artists and volunteers on site, they had collected clothes and prepared a dinner for them. At the end of the day, the women were given a bag full of hygiene items. Several beneficiaries have asked for this event to come back next year.

Placemark.name: Le P'tit Bonheur Workcamp
Placemark.description:
May 22nd - June 8th

15 volunteers will participate in the reconstruction of a Yurt-shaped kitchenette, renovate an activity site called the Fortress and help in the kitchen. Their work will improve the quality of activities and social environment of the campers.

Le P'tit Bonheur is an non for profit outdoor base.

Placemark.name: The Duke of Edinburgh's International Award Passion to Purpose
Placemark.description: Passion to Purpose is a 5 day youth forum where participants take part in inspirational keynotes, workshops, team building exercises and outdoor activities that develop their passions for change into a concrete action plan that will be executed within their communities.

Placemark.name: Tool library
Placemark.description: Un atelier communautaire/bibliothèque à outils pour Hochelaga/Maisonneuve, Je veux aider les gens à devenir plus autonomes, encourager le partage et diminuer la consommation, favoriser le transfert de savoir et aider les gens qui ont des projets de bricolages mais pas de garage en banlieue à les réaliser.

Placemark.name: Workcamp II in Ste-Thérèse
Placemark.description:
15 volunteers will bring out the ecological and natural character of the Jardin des sources. They will be working with youth from the Ste-Théreèse youth club who will help clean up paths, plant trees and clean the lake and rivers surrounding the site.

-> July 28th - August 12th

Placemark.name: Workcamp in Les éboulements
Placemark.description: Volunteers will participate in the general maintenance of a camp ground and its buildings, redesign a walking trail, paint some camp buildings, build modules for adventurous trails. They will also take part in the organization of an open-house day event of the beautiful site.

Placemark.name: Workcamp in Saint-Bruno-de-Kamouraska
Placemark.description: Volunteers from Canada and abroad with the help of local volunteers, will work on the relaying of an intergenerational park : repair park benches, redesign walking paths and floral arrangements to enrich the lives of this community of 540 people.

Placemark.name: Workcamp in Saint-Zénon
Placemark.description: The volunteers will build walking trails and wooden belvederes at the Sept-Chutes Regional Park. They will be contributing to the development of the site so that visitors can enjoy the beautiful landscapes as well as the wildlife and floral diversity.

Placemark.name: Workcamp in Sainte-Thérèse
Placemark.description:
volunteers will bring out the ecological and natural character of the Jardin des sources. They will be working with youth from the Ste-Théreèse youth club who will help clean up paths, plant trees and clean the lake and rivers surrounding the site.

-> June 30th- July 22nd

Placemark.name: youthexperts team (mindyourmind)
Placemark.description: We partnered with Laing House and Heartwood Centre for Youth Community Development in Halifax, NS. The youth created a mental health workbook and a video.
